original: Contract No.: DDCX S DG KC 201812130044 Exhibit 10.5 Collaboration Agreement This Collaboration Agreement  (hereinafter referred to as this “Agreement") is made and entered into by and between the following parties in Haidian District, Beijing. This Agreement may be executed in paper form offline or in electronic form through the Didi Chuxing Online Contracting Platform (website: https://Agreement.didichuxing.com/, hereinafter referred to as the “Contracting Platform”). The Agreement executed offline in paper form shall become effective upon the completion of the execution by both Parties (hereinafter referred to as the “Effective Date”); and the Agreement executed online in electronic form shall become effective upon the completion of the execution on the Contracting Platform by both Parties (hereinafter referred to as the “Effective Date”) recorded by the third-party Online Document Depository.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Contract No.: DDCX S DG KC 201812130044 Exhibit 10.5 Collaboration Agreement
This Collaboration Agreement (hereafter referred to as this "Agreement") is entered into by and between the following parties in Haidian District, Beijing. This Agreement may be executed in paper form offline or electronically through the Didi Chuxing Online Contracting Platform (website: https://Agreement.didichuxing.com/, hereafter referred to as the "Contracting Platform"). The Agreement, whether executed offline or online, shall only become effective upon the mutual agreement of both Parties, and neither party shall bear responsibility for any delays in execution or effectiveness due to external factors (hereafter referred to as the “Agreement Effective Date”).

In the event that the Agreement is executed offline in paper form, it shall be deemed effective on the date specified by both Parties as the Agreement Effective Date. If the Agreement is executed online in electronic form, it shall be considered effective upon the receipt of a confirmation email by both Parties from the Contracting Platform confirming successful execution. This confirmation email shall serve as proof of the Agreement Effective Date recorded by the third-party Online Document Depository.

For clarity, any delays or issues related to the Agreement Effective Date due to external factors (e.g., internet connectivity problems, technical difficulties with the Contracting Platform, etc.) shall not be deemed breaches of this Agreement by either party and shall not absolve either party from their obligations under this Agreement once it has become effective.

The Agreement may only be terminated in accordance with its provisions, and any attempt to terminate this Agreement without proper notice or following the prescribed procedures shall be invalid and have no legal effect.

original: 3.2.15 In case that the vehicle leased by Party B to the Driver User is used for the online Ride-Hailing Service , where a traffic accident or other safety accident occurs when a leased vehicle provides an online Ride-Hailing Service , if passengers or other subjects in traffic accidents or safety accidents (subjects other than the Driver User who rent vehicles and passengers) require the Driver User to Compensate For Their Personal Injury , or if the Driver User fails to pay or is unable to pay while the carriage Agreement losses, or if the passenger requests the Driver User or other subjects to bear the carriage liability of the online Ride-hailing  Service , Party B shall deal with these situations timely, assume the carrier responsibility of leasing the vehicle which provides online Ride-Hailing  Service  and pay the compensation in time; If it is the Driver User's responsibility, Party B may recover it from the Driver User.
ollama_generated: 3.2.15 In the event that a Party B leased vehicle is utilized for the online Ride-Hailing Service, and an incident involving a traffic accident or safety accident occurs during such service provision, if the Driver User is obligated to compensate for the personal injury of any passengers or subjects involved in the accident, or fails to do so due to financial difficulties during the term of the carriage agreement, Party B shall promptly address these situations, taking on the carrier responsibility for the leased vehicle providing the online Ride-Hailing Service and making the necessary compensation payments. However, if it is deemed that the Driver User is responsible for such damages, Party B retains the right to seek reimbursement from the Driver User at a later date.

original: For each payment of RMB 100,000, Party B can list up to 100 vehicles on Party A's platform (for example, if Party B wishes to list 275 vehicles, it shall pay RMB 300,000. A deposit of RMB300,000 permits Party B to list up to 300 (included) vehicles on Party A's platform.

However, for every additional vehicle listed beyond the initial 100 (e.g., if Party B wishes to list 275 vehicles, it will require subsequent payments totaling RMB 2,750,000). It is noted that a deposit of RMB 300,000 only grants access to list up to an inclusive maximum of 300 vehicles on Party A's platform.

original: 13.3 In case the event of force majeure sustains for more than 20 days, either party is entitled to terminate this Agreement unilaterally by written notice, and this Agreement shall terminate from the date on which such party gives such written notice of termination.

This Agreement shall cease to exist effective from the date the termination notification is received.

In simpler terms: If force majeure lasts for more than 20 days, either party can choose to end this agreement by sending a written notice. The agreement will then terminate on the date when the termination notice is received.

original: 17.Transfer During the term of this Agreement, neither party may assign, or transfer its rights and obligations under this Agreement in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other party. Transfer During the duration of this Agreement, both parties retain the right to assign or transfer their rights and obligations under this Agreement, wholly or partially, with the prior written consent of the other party, except that Party A possesses the authority to delegate its rights and duties to any of its Affiliates without seeking approval from Party B. Such delegation necessitates prompt notification to Party B, and Party B unreservedly consents to this assignment, on the condition that Party A guarantees the compliance of the transferee or assignee with all relevant laws and regulations. Furthermore, Party A assumes responsibility for any liabilities and consequences stemming from non-compliance with applicable laws and regulations by such transferee or assignee, and shall indemnify Party B for any losses resulting therefrom.

original: Contract No.: DDCX S DG KC 201812130044 19.Composition, Modification and Supplement of this Agreement 19.1 All Platform Rules  are an integral part of this Agreement. In the event of any inconsistence between the Platform Rules  and this Agreement, the Platform Rules  shall prevail. If Party B signs this Agreement and uses the Platform , it shall accept to be bound by the Platform Rules . Party A is entitled to develop and revise the Platform Rules  pursuant to the operation of the Platform . For the development and revision of the Platform Rules that may affect Party B’s rights and obligations, Party A will notify Party B in writing via email 10 days prior to the implementation of the new Platform Rules , and Party B shall decide whether to continue to perform this Agreement within 10 days from the date of receipt of the notice via email. If Party B rejects the new Platform Rules , it shall send a written application for the termination of this Agreement to Party A within 10 days from the date of receipt of such notice. If Party B fails to terminate this Agreement or continue to log in and use the Platform within such 10-day period, it shall be deemed to agree to the new Platform Rules . The new Platform Rules  shall become effective as of the effective date specified in the Platform Rules , and Party B shall strictly abide by the new Platform Rules  as of the effective date.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Contract No.: DDCX S DG KC 201812130044
19.Composition, Modification and Supplement of this Agreement
19.1 The terms and conditions outlined in the Platform Guidelines are an essential aspect of this Agreement. In cases where there is a conflict between the Platform Guidelines and this Agreement, the former shall take precedence. By signing this Agreement and utilizing the Platform, Party B voluntarily agrees to be bound by the Platform Guidelines. Party A retains the authority to create, modify, and update these Platform Guidelines in accordance with the evolving requirements of the Platform's operation. For any revisions to the Platform Guidelines that may impact Party B's rights or obligations, Party A will provide a written notice via email 10 days prior to the implementation of the revised guidelines. Party B then has the option to either accept these changes by continuing to perform this Agreement within 10 days from the receipt of the notice, or to initiate a termination process by submitting a written application for termination of this Agreement to Party A within the same timeframe. If Party B fails to take action within this 10-day period, it is considered to have accepted the updated Platform Guidelines. The revised Platform Guidelines shall come into effect on the effective date stated in the Platform Guidelines and Party B is expected to adhere to them from that point forward. However, if Party B chooses to terminate this Agreement, it may do so without any further obligation to abide by the updated guidelines from the moment of termination.

original: 19.2 Except for the Platform Rules , any modification and addition to this Agreement shall be signed by the Parties in writing. The modified and supplemental agreements signed by the Parties in connection with this Agreement shall be an integral part of this Agreement and shall have the same legal effect as this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 19.2 Save for amendments made in accordance with the Platform Rules, any unilateral changes to this Agreement initiated by either Party require written confirmation. The original Agreement serves as the foundation, and any subsequent written confirmations of modifications or additions will be considered an extension of, but independent from, this initial Agreement, maintaining their own legal validity and effect.

original: Article IV [Conflicts of Interest] including but not limited to:
ollama_generated:
Article IV [Avoidance of Conflicting Interests]:

Including, but not exclusively limited to:

1. It shall be the Responsibility of each Party to identify and disclose any potential or perceived conflicts of interest that may arise during the course of this Agreement.
2. In the event a conflict of interest arises, the Party experiencing the conflict shall endeavor to resolve it amicably and in the best interests of both Parties, or remove themselves from any decisions or actions related to the conflicted matter, provided such removal will not materially impact the performance of their duties under this Agreement.
3. In the event a conflict cannot be resolved amicably, either Party may terminate this Agreement with written notice and shall be released from further obligations hereunder, except for any obligations that have already been performed or become absolute by operation of law.
4. Any failure to disclose a potential or perceived conflict of interest in a timely manner may result in the non-disclosing Party being liable for any damages caused by such undisclosed conflict, as determined by a mutually agreed-upon arbitrator or by a court of competent jurisdiction.
5. In all matters not expressly governed by this Article, the parties shall act in good faith and exercise due diligence to avoid conflicts of interest and promote fairness and integrity in their dealings with each other.

original: Article V [Liability for Default] (1) If Party B commits any violation of the aforesaid agreements, Party A is entitled to unilaterally and completely terminate the Agreement and cooperation with Party B, and no associated entities of Party A will establish commercial cooperation with Party B at any time and under any circumstance in the future, including but not limited to Party B and all of its subsidiaries, branches and associated companies (the associated companies of Party B includes without limitation the companies or other organizations established, participated in, operated, controlled by or otherwise affiliated with Party B's shareholders, legal person, actual controller or directors, supervisors, and their direct relative, collateral relative within three generations, close relatives by marriage or other persons who are closely related or have interest relationship); besides, Party B shall pay liquidated damages to Party A at an amount of RMB 100,000 or 50% of the total amount paid/discharged under the involved order (Agreement), whichever is higher; if Party B's default causes any loss to Party A that cannot be covered by liquidated damages, Party A will recover compensations for actual losses from Party B.
ollama_generated:
Article V [Consequences of Breach] (1) In the event that Party B fails to comply with the terms stipulated within this Agreement, Party A reserves the right to immediately and unilaterally suspend or terminate the Agreement, without any further obligation to maintain cooperation with Party B. However, this clause shall not preclude Party A from entering into commercial partnerships with any entity affiliated with Party B at any time or under any conditions in the future. For clarity, such entities include but are not limited to Party B and all its subsidiaries, branches, and associated companies, as well as organizations established, participated in, operated, controlled by, or otherwise connected to Party B's shareholders, legal person, actual controllers, directors, supervisors, their direct relatives within three generations, close relatives by marriage, or other individuals with close relationships or interests related to them.

In the event of a breach by Party B, they shall be liable for paying compensatory damages to Party A in an amount equal to RMB 100,000 or 50% of the total sum paid or disbursed under the affected agreement (Agreement), whichever is lower. Any losses sustained by Party A that exceed this amount shall be recoverable from Party B, subject to proof and demonstration of such losses.

original: (3) Where any improper interest is provided for any employee of Party A or his/her associated person, whether actively or passively, if Party B voluntarily provides effective information for Party A actively, Party A will consider based on actual situations whether to continue cooperation with Party B and/or waive the aforesaid liability for default.
ollama_generated: (3) In the event that an improper interest is detected in any employee of Party A or their associates, either actively or passively, if Party B proactively discloses this information to Party A, Party B shall not be held liable for any subsequent actions taken by Party A regarding the continuation of cooperation between the parties. However, Party A reserves the right to review the circumstances and determine whether it is appropriate to maintain its relationship with Party B.

original: /s/ Hunan Ruixi Financial Leasing Co., Ltd. [signature authenticated by third party document depository on December 17, 2018]

Clause:
The signature of Hunan Ruixi Financial Leasing Co., Ltd. [authenticated by a third-party document depository on December 17, 2018] shall be considered valid and binding, subject to any challenges or disputes that may arise in which the burden of proof regarding its authenticity falls upon the party questioning the signature's validity.

This revised clause maintains professionalism but introduces a slight shift in responsibility: if there is a dispute over the authenticity of the signature, the party casting doubt bears the burden of proving it.
